oai_dc:dc.dc:title: AN EXPERIMENTAL STUDY ON SAND DUNE SEDIMENT TRANSPORT DUE TO TSUNAMI OVERWASH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Raju, K M Ahtesham Hossain
Sato, Shinji
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Overwash
Sand dune
Sediment transport
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Response of sand dune when overwashed by tsunami or storm surge, is investigated by conducting small scale laboratory study. Dune consisting of initially wet sand and initially dry sand are tested for three different sand grain sizes. Overtopping of water and the corresponding sediment transport are analyzed. These data set can be used to validate mathematical models associated with dune sediment transport as well as prediction of dune profile.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 35 (2016): Proceedings of 35th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Antalya, Turkey, 2016; sediment.15
